definition: to feed the enemy misinformation through their own spies/to sow discord in the enemy camp
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
stratagem of sowing dissension/CL:條|条[tiao2]
counterintelligence/protection against espionage

sentences.english: Together, it is the most award-winning combined antivirus and antispyware on the market today.
sentences.chinese: 一起，这是最屡获殊荣的市场整合防毒和反间谍今天。

sentences.english: I was a member of the 15th Marine Counterintelligence Team, operating just below the Demilitarized Zone.
sentences.chinese: 我是反间谍第15组的成员，就在非武装区之外活动。

sentences.english: Your computer should have anti-virus and anti-spyware software.
sentences.chinese: 你的电脑应该有防病毒和反间谍软件。

sentences.english: A very good free anti-spyware program is AdAware.
sentences.chinese: AdAware是一个很好的免费反间谍软件程序。

sentences.english: Alternatively, there are other free anti-spyware software programs available.
sentences.chinese: 另外，还有一些其他的免费的反间谍软件程序可用。

sentences.english: Run antispyware programs on a regular basis.
sentences.chinese: 定期运行反间谍软件程序。

sentences.english: Why do many people like to use discord among it?
sentences.chinese: 为什么许多人喜欢用反间计呢？

sentences.english: The center will focus on the related disciplines of CI and HUMINT.
sentences.chinese: 该中心将关注反间谍与人工情报的相关条例。

sentences.english: Run one or two anti-spyware applications.
sentences.chinese: 运行一两款反间谍软件。

sentences.english: Both companies offer the anti-spyware software suite at no charge.
sentences.chinese: 这两个公司都向自己的用户免费提供反间谍服务。

sentences.english: Added ability to remove Counter Spy-Plane effects with the Jammer.
sentences.chinese: 新增功能以消除干扰机与反间谍飞机的影响。

definition: stratagem of sowing dissension/CL:條|条[tiao2]
interlocked stratagems/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to drive a wedge between (allies, partners etc)
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
stratagem/scheme
feigned surrender
undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks
using spies
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to employ a stratagem
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
